Wen Payoka then turned his gaze to
Wose. And though the wolf had long
discarded his cowardice, he found

Wen Payoka saw his chance, and
swung his great arm down toward
the wolf. But just before it met him,
Sana shielded Wose with her body.

Sana begged her friend to run—
but seeing her wounds filled

fangs into the beast's throat, and
used all his fury to tear it open.

The fiend slain, he turned then to
Sana once more. ＂You were...
Kamuy...all along...＂ she said, those
words her last. As her eyes dimmed,
they wrinkled with pride.

Having witnessed his master's final
moments, Wose disappeared into the
snowfields. The people of the village
he saved revered him for many years
after, and knew him as Kamuy.

沃塞便消失在雪原裡。

拯救村落的狼龍，
並尊稱他為「勇猛的守護龍神威」。

context.en_us:
And though his whereabouts remain
unknown, people say he still protects
the land his master loved to this day.
- From the folktale, ＂Roaring Kamuy＂

但是，人們深信，
